big_picture_notes: Luke opens with a formal proemium (1:1–4) pledging an orderly account (kathexes) that advances by geography: Preparation/Infancy (1–2), Galilee (3–9:50), the Great Journey (9:51–19:27), and Jerusalem Passion/Resurrection (19:28–24:53). The hinge is 9:51 (‘set his face to go to Jerusalem’). Literary glue includes doublets (paired annunciations/births), programmatic songs (Magnificat, Benedictus, Nunc Dimittis), reversal/inclusion themes, spread‑of‑fame notices, and amazement/glorifying refrains, all assuring Theophilus of the certainty of what is taught.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Infancy narrative framed by the proemium and Jesus’ growth summary. Start (1:1): formal preface; End (2:52): closure of childhood arc. Glue: annunciation/birth doublets, songs, fulfillment and joy.
